definition: gate/door/CL:扇[shan4]/gateway/doorway/CL:個|个[ge4]/opening/valve/switch/way to do something/knack/family/house/(religious) sect/school (of thought)/class/category/phylum or division (taxonomy)/classifier for large guns/classifier for lessons, subjects, branches of technology/(suffix) -gate (i.e. scandal; derived from Watergate)
Xiamen or Amoy, subprovincial city in Fujian, abbr. 廈|厦[Xia4]
(soccer, handball etc) to kick or shoot the ball towards the goal
doorstep/sill/threshold/fig. knack or trick (esp. scheme to get sth cheaper)
to go out/to leave home/to go on a journey/away from home/(of a woman) to get married

sentences.english: He didn't hit out, but hit the wicket by a fluke.
sentences.chinese: 他並未用力擊球，卻歪打正着擊中了三柱門。

sentences.english: If it is referring to the Shinto shrine, then known as the Torii gate.
sentences.chinese: 如果是指神道教的神社的話，那個門叫做鳥居。

sentences.english: Door hinged on the left hand side, one-hand operation, lockable.
sentences.chinese: 門絞鏈在左面，單手操作，有門鎖。

sentences.english: The kep overcomes the defect that the original door has low coefficient of a safety tool.
sentences.chinese: 克服了原有門安全工具係數小的缺點。

sentences.english: Jobic took his bar of iron and broke open the other door.
sentences.chinese: 若比用他的鐵棒撬開了另一個門。

sentences.english: Nine men knock at the nice door near the net.
sentences.chinese: 九個男人在敲網子邊的那扇漂亮門。

sentences.english: As I arrived at the bus stop the driver opened his big manual hinged door.
sentences.chinese: 等我到了巴士站，司機用手拉開那道大鉸鏈門。

sentences.english: He hissed me and pointed to the door where a man came out.
sentences.chinese: 他向我噓了一聲，並指了指有人走出來的那個門。

sentences.english: The doors were painted blue to match the walls.
sentences.chinese: 門漆成了蘭色，爲的是與牆的顏色相配。

sentences.english: The door was closed, so he knocked, but there was no answer.
sentences.chinese: 門緊閉着，他敲一下門，裏面沒有迴應。

sentences.english: The closure was announced last week as the paper was caught up in a phone hacking scandal.
sentences.chinese: 該集團因電話竊聽門而於上星期宣佈關閉。

sentences.english: Several dead bodies lay under the portrait of Mao on Tiananmen Gate.
sentences.chinese: 幾具屍體放置在毛之下畫象在天安門門。

sentences.english: Behindher, the first gate closed, trapping them like a ship in a lock.
sentences.chinese: 第一個門緩緩地合上了，就像一道閉合的船閘。

sentences.english: The thuds coming from the door were getting louder and more hurried.
sentences.chinese: 門“嘭”地一聲，急促而又大聲地。

sentences.english: The door opened and out came a woodsman .
sentences.chinese: 門馬上打開了，一位樵夫走了出來。

sentences.english: Doors shall have vision panels and be self closing.
sentences.chinese: 門應該有觀察窗和自鎖裝置。

definition: to go forward/to advance/to go in/to enter/to put in/to submit/to take in/to admit/(math.) base of a number system/classifier for sections in a building or residential compound
for a particular person, occasion, purpose/focused on one thing/special/expert/particular (to sth)/concentrated/specialized
to open a door (lit. and fig.)/to open for business
to agree (to do sth)/should/ought to/must/(legal) shall
to answer/to respond/to comply with/to deal or cope with
only/merely/no more than/but/however/anyway (to get back to a previous topic)/cannot be more (after adjectival)
to link/to join/to connect/continuously/in succession/including/(used with 也[ye3], 都[dou1] etc) even/company (military)
between/among/within a definite time or space/room/section of a room or lateral space between two pairs of pillars/classifier for rooms
gap/to separate/to thin out (seedlings)/to sow discontent
preparation/to prepare/to intend/to be about to/reserve (fund)
Mt Hua 華山|华山 in Shaanxi/surname Hua

to open/to start/to turn on/to boil/to write out (a prescription, check, invoice etc)/to operate (a vehicle)/carat (gold)/abbr. for Kelvin, 開爾文|开尔文[Kai1 er3 wen2]/abbr. for 開本|开本[kai1 ben3], book format
